author: wmtan
body: The last use of the deprecated std::auto_ptr in the CMS framework is the "put" interface for EDProducts, which also supports std::unique:ptr. This PR changes all put calls in alignment and calibration to use std::unique_ptr instead of std::auto_ptr. Some other instances of std::auto_ptr in alignment and calibration may also have been changed to std::unique_ptr. Also, at the request of @ghellwig, make_unique was used throughout, and some raw pointers that could cause problems were changed to unique_ptr.
title: Use unique_ptr, not auto_ptr, in Alignment/Calibration
